statement.tex: \text{Solve this Linear Programming problem}\\ \text{graphically. Minimise } Z=3x+5y \text{ subject}\\ \text{to the constraints } x+3y \ge 3,\, x+y \ge 2\\ \text{and } (x , y) \ge 0

step.context: \text{What is the value of the minimum as per} \\ \text{the corner points seen in the graph?}
step.tex: \begin{align} \text{Corner Points}\qquad &Z=3x+5y \\ (0, 2) \qquad &10 \\ (1.5, 0.5) \qquad &7 \\ (3, 0) \qquad &9 \end{align}\\ \text{Minimum cannot be predicted by this alone.}
step.reason: \text{The feasible region is unbounded so we can}\\ \text{not say for sure that 7 is the minimum}

step.context: \text{Does the open half plane created by}\\ 3x+5y\lt 7\text{ overlap with the feasible region?}
